alert.note: Alert for Florence (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 10:36AM CDT until April 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River near Koss affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Menominee River at White Rapids Dam affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Forest, Florence, Iron and Dickinson Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Peshtigo River below Caldron Falls Dam affecting Marinette County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Iron and Dickinson Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Florence. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Floodwaters reach a few homes and cottages along Runbers Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Monday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 06/15/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
